## Preliminary analysis
Quick glance at the frequencies of demographics. We have very little respondents in many categories, which will mess up our analysis later on, so I decided to combine or remove some of them. For Q5, I combined '18-24 years old', '55-64 years old', and '65-74 years old' into the category 'Other' (even combined they only add up to 69 respondents, which is 15% of the data). For Q6, I combined all categories that weren't full time employees into Other (and even then, they only make up 17% of the data). For Q7, I combined '1-2 years', and '3-5 years' into '1-5 years'. For Q8, I combined '0-6 months', '7-12 months', and '1-2 years' into '0-2 years'. Also, '11-15 years', '16-25 years', and '25 years or more' into '11-25 years or more'. For Q9, I just combined everything that is not caucasian into 'Other'. For Q10, I just removed the non-gender categories, since literally only 2 people responded to those. For Q11, I combined everything that is not North America/central. Finally, for Q12 I combined everything that is below a bachelor's degree into 'Below Bachelors', and I combined doctoral and master degree into "Grad School Degree". For the other demographic data, categories are so different I don't think I can combine them in a logical way.

```{r analysis}
library(stargazer)
correlation<-cor(final_data, final_data[32:38], use="complete.obs")
#write.csv(correlation, "correlations.csv")

regOCB<-final_data%>%select('Achievement_Oriented':'Hexaco')
regOCB<-lm(OCB~., data=regOCB)
summary(regOCB)

regCWB<-final_data%>%select('Achievement_Oriented':'Hexaco', 'CWB')
regCWB<-lm(CWB~., data=regCWB)
summary(regCWB)

regTaskPersormance<-final_data%>%select('Achievement_Oriented':'Hexaco', 'Task_performance')
regTaskPersormance<-lm(Task_performance~., data=regTaskPersormance)
summary(regTaskPersormance)

regIntentionToStay<-final_data%>%select('Achievement_Oriented':'Hexaco', 'Intention_to_stay')
regIntentionToStay<-lm(Intention_to_stay~., data=regIntentionToStay)
summary(regIntentionToStay)

regEngagement<-final_data%>%select('Achievement_Oriented':'Hexaco', 'Engagement')
regEngagement<-lm(Engagement~., data=regEngagement)
summary(regEngagement)

regIncivility<-final_data%>%select('Achievement_Oriented':'Hexaco', 'Incivility')
regIncivility<-lm(Incivility~., data=regIncivility)
summary(regIncivility)


regIDK<-final_data%>%select('Achievement_Oriented':'Hexaco', 'IDK')
regIDK<-lm(IDK~., data=regIDK)
summary(regIDK)
```
